Cards.Option1: What group has the highest status in the community? What must people do to gain inclusion in this group?
Cards.Option2: Are there distinct family units in the community? If so, what family structures are common?

Cards.Option1: There’s a large body of water on the map. Where is it? What does it look like?
Cards.Option2: There’s a giant man-made structure on the map. Where is it? Why is it abandoned?

Cards.Option1: Someone new arrives. Who?
Cards.Option2: Two of the community’s younger members get into a fight. What provoked them?

Cards.Option1: What important and basic tools does the community lack?
Cards.Option2: Where are you storing your food? Why is this a risky place to store things?

Cards.Option1: There is a disquieting legend about this place. What is it?
Cards.Option2: Alarming weather patterns destroy something. How and what?

Cards.Option1: Are there children in the community? If there are, what is their role in the community?
Cards.Option2: How old are the eldest members of the community? What unique needs do they have?

Cards.Option1: Where does everyone sleep? Who is unhappy with this arrangement, and why?
Cards.Option2: What natural predators roam this area? Are you safe?

Cards.Option1: An old piece of machinery is discovered, broken but perhaps repairable. What is it? What would it be useful for?
Cards.Option2: An old piece of machinery is discovered, cursed and dangerous. How does the community destroy it?

Cards.Option1: A charismatic young girl convinces many to help her with an elaborate scheme. What is it? Who joins her endeavors? **Start a project to reflect.**
Cards.Option2: A charismatic young girl tries to tempt many into sinful or dangerous activity. Why does she do this? How does the community respond?

Cards.Option1: There’s another community somewhere on the map. Where are they? What sets them apart from you?
Cards.Option2: What belief or practice helps to unify your community?

Cards.Option1: You see a good omen. What is it?
Cards.Option2: You see a bad omen. What is it?

Cards.Option1: What’s the most beautiful thing in this area?
Cards.Option2: What’s the most hideous thing in this area?

Cards.Option1: A young boy starts digging in the ground, and discovers something unexpected. What is it?
Cards.Option2: An old man confesses to past crimes and atrocities. What has he done?

Cards.Option1: A contingent within the community demand to be heard. Who are they? What are they asking for?
Cards.Option2: A contingent within the community have acted on their frustrations. What have they damaged, and why did they damage it? Is it permanent?

Cards.Option1: Someone new arrives. Who? Why are they in distress?
Cards.Option2: Someone leaves the community. Who? What are they looking for?

Cards.Option1: Summer is a time for production and tending to the earth. **Start a project related to food production.**
Cards.Option2: Summer is a time for conquest and the gathering of might. **Start a project related to military readiness and conquest.**

Cards.Option1: The eldest among you dies. What caused the death?
Cards.Option2: The eldest among you is very sick. Caring for them and searching for a cure requires the help of the entire community. **Do not reduce project dice this week.**

Cards.Option1: **A project finishes early.** What led to its early completion?
Cards.Option2: The weather is nice and people can feel the potential all around them. **Start a new project.**

Cards.Option1: Outsiders arrive in the area. Why are they a threat? How are they vulnerable?
Cards.Option2: Outsiders arrive in the area. How many? How are they greeted?

Cards.Option1: Introduce a mystery at the edge of the map.
Cards.Option2: An unattended situation becomes problematic and scary. What is it? How does it go awry?

Cards.Option1: Someone tries to take control of the community by force. Do they succeed? Why do they do this?
Cards.Option2: A headstrong community member decides to put one of their ideas in motion. **Start a foolish project.**

Cards.Option1: **A project fails.** Which one? Why?
Cards.Option2: Something goes foul and supplies are ruined. **Add a new Scarcity.**

Cards.Option1: You discover a cache of supplies or resources. **Add a new Abundance.**
Cards.Option2: A Scarcity has gone unaddressed for too long! **Start a project that will alleviate that Scarcity.**

Cards.Option1: Predators and bad omens are afoot. You are careless, and someone goes missing under ominous circumstances. Who?
Cards.Option2: Predators and bad omens are afoot. What measures do you take to keep everyone safe and under surveillance? **Do not reduce project dice this week.**

Cards.Option1: **A project finishes early.** Which one? Why?
Cards.Option2: ***If there are no projects underway,*** boredom leads to a quarrel. A fight breaks out between two people. What is it about?

Cards.Text: Summer is fleeting. **Discard the top two cards off the top of the deck and take two actions this week.**
The community becomes obsessed with a single project. Which one? Why? ***If there are no projects underway, add a Scarcity born of idleness.***
Cards.Option1: They decide to take more time to ensure that it is perfect. **Add 3 weeks to the project die.**
Cards.Option2: They drop everything else to work on it. **All other projects fail.**

Cards.Option1: Someone returns to the community. Who? Where were they?
Cards.Option2: You find a body. Do people recognize who it is? What happened?

Cards.Option1: Someone leaves the community after issuing a dire warning. Who? What is the warning?
Cards.Option2: Someone issues a dire warning, and the community leaps into action to avoid disaster. What is the warning? **Start a contentious project that relates to it.**

Cards.Option1: The strongest among you dies. What caused the death?
Cards.Option2: The weakest among you dies. Who’s to blame for their death?

Cards.Option1: The Parish arrives. Who are they? Why have they chosen your community, and for what?
Cards.Option2: A small gang of marauders is making its way through local terrain. How many are there? What weapons do they carry?

Cards.Option1: Introduce a dark mystery among the members of the community.
Cards.Option2: Conflict flares up among community members, and as a result, **a project fails.**

Cards.Option1: A project just isn’t working out as expected. **Radically change the nature of this project (don’t modify the project die). When it resolves, you’ll be responsible for telling the community how it went.**
Cards.Option2: Something goes foul and supplies are ruined. **Add a new Scarcity.**

Cards.Option1: Someone sabotages a project, and **the project fails** as a result. Who did this? Why?
Cards.Option2: Someone is caught trying to sabotage the efforts of the community. How does the community respond?

Cards.Option1: The community works constantly, and as a result **a project finishes early.**
Cards.Option2: A group goes out to explore the map more thoroughly, and finds something that had been previously overlooked.

Cards.Option1: Harvest is here and plentiful. Add an Abundance.
Cards.Option2: Cold autumn winds drive out your enemies. **Remove a threatening force from the map and the area.**

Cards.Option1: **A project finishes early.** Which one? Why?
Cards.Option2: ***If there are no projects underway,*** restlessness creates animosity, which leads to violence. Who gets hurt?

Cards.Option1: You spend the week quarantining and treating the disease. **Project dice are not reduced this week.**
Cards.Option2: Nobody knows what to do about it. **Add “Health and Fertility” as a Scarcity.**

Cards.Text: A natural disaster strikes the area.
Cards.Option1: You focus on getting everyone to safety. **Remove an Abundance and a project fails.**
Cards.Option2: You focus on protecting your supplies and hardwork at any cost. Several people die as a result.

Cards.Option1: Now is the time to conserve energy and resources. **A project fails, but gain an Abundance.**
Cards.Option2: Now is the time for hurried labour and final efforts. **A project finishes early, but gain a Scarcity.**

Cards.Option1: A headstrong community member takes charge of the community’s work efforts. **A project fails, and then a different project finishes early.**
Cards.Option2: A headstrong community member tries to take control of the community. How are they prevented from doing this? Due to the conflict, **project dice are not reduced this week.**

Cards.Option1: Someone comes up with an ingenious solution to a big problem, and as a result **a project finishes early.** What was their idea?
Cards.Option2: Someone comes up with a plan to ensure safety and comfort during the coldest months. **Start a project related to this.**

Cards.Option1: All the animals and young children are crying and won’t stop. **Hold a discussion about this, in addition to your regular action for this week.**
Cards.Option2: A great atrocity is revealed. What is it? Who uncovers it?

Cards.Option1: Winter elements destroy a food source. If this was your only food source, **add a Scarcity.**
Cards.Option2: Winter elements leave everyone cold, tired, and miserable. **Project dice are not reduced this week.**

Cards.Option1: The time has come to consolidate your efforts and your borders. **Projects located outside the settlement fail, and all remaining projects are reduced by 2 this week.**
Cards.Option2: Someone finds a curious opportunity on the edge of the map. **Start a project related to this discovery.**

Cards.Text: What is winter like in this area? How do community members react to the weather?
Winter is harsh, and desperation gives rise to fear mongering.
Cards.Option1: Spend the week calming the masses and dispelling their violent sentiments. **The week ends immediately.**
Cards.Option2: Declare war on someone or something. **This counts as starting a project.**

Cards.Text: Someone goes missing. They’re alone in the winter elements.
Cards.Option1: The community organizes constant search parties and eventually the person is found. **Project dice are not reduced this week.**
Cards.Option2: No one ever hears from that person again.

Cards.Text: In preparation for the coming year, the community begins a huge undertaking. **Start a project that will take at least 5 weeks to complete.**
An infected outsider arrives, seeking amnesty. They have some much-needed resources with them. Choose one:
Cards.Option1: Welcome them into the community. **Remove a Scarcity,** but also introduce an infection into the community.
Cards.Option2: Bar them from entry. What Scarcity could they have addressed? How does its need become more dire this week?

Cards.Text: You see a good omen. What is it?
The Frost Shepherds arrive. **The game is over.**
